text: We regularly visit this wonderful hotel and only have positive things to say. The views and location are spectacular but the culture of the hotel is testimony to the amazing staff who work here. Every one of them is friendly, welcoming and helpful - even at the busiest of times, and their hard work is evident.This year we tried something new on offer from the hotel - a private wine tasting experience. We can highly recommend. A selection of fabulous Algarvian wines, with the most beautifully crafted, tasty canapés, overlooking the wonderful views from The One restaurant was an experience to remember. Bernardo, our guide, is clearly an expert in his field, his warm manner and his knowledge meant our experience was informative and fun!  Thank you Bernardo!We look forward to trying the mocktail/cocktail making experience next time we visit!Thank you once again Tivoli Carvoeiro, we can’t wait to come back!

Excellent staff from front desk to housekeeping. Resort pristinely clean and well maintained. Very quiet and peaceful. Bed very comfortable. Direct beach and hiking access.We enjoyed our stay immensely.Unequivocally very highly recommended.

The hotel has absolut all standarts.the staff is so friendly and the food and the view over funchal is awesome.The only things I have to complain is 1. The air conditioning was not working properly.The cleaning lady was not really good...saw lot of dirt traces in the bathroom after she cleaned.The shower is not the latest version...The sauna in the spa area looks really cheap and not nice at all.The hotel is a good one but too good rated!

I went to his hotel purely for a massage as my hotel uses this hotel as its spa. Zoe was the massage therapist and I have to admit, probably the best massage I have ever had ( and I have a lot of massages on holiday!!!! At least 4-5 every week I am away ). I had a deep tissue and it was perfect, enough pressure to take out the knots but not to much that it hurt. In fact it was that good, the whole family is going tomorrow, says everything really. Thanks
A lot of money for the conditions they present, little sympathy, they don't even ask how it went, at least give an aspiradela in the house....

My family and I had an amazing time, such clean and beautiful facilities. the staff was so caring and made our stay very relaxing. Would definitely love to return here! On top of great service, the food and drinks were very enjoyable. the walk to the beach was perfect and the town was so close that we could enjoy all the local restaurants and spots.

First time staying here and was very impressed. Location was very good as it was less than a 5 minute walk to the beach, however you need to get taxis into town to eat etc every night as it is around a 30/ minute walk depending on what side of town you are on. The facilities available such as the gym, spa and pools were fab and very well looked after. Staff were very friendly and helpful!We stayed in a 3 bed apartment for a week - plenty of space and good facilities within the room/kitchen were available. My only niggle was that our apartment only got cleaned twice, one being the afternoon on the day before we went home. This meant we only had one shower towel and one beach towel for the holiday!On the whole it was a very pleasant stay and would stay there again :-)

This hotel is just okay, the large resort environment I have learned is not my preference. We visited June 6-8, when we arrived my friend was anxious to go the beach but it was closed, we never did get an explanation why. There was a wedding & events taking place at the resort and many of the restaurants were closed to private events. Friday night the sky bar was even closed which was disappointing as the views up there are great. The worst part of our stay was the smell in our room, it was indescribably bad. That said, they sent someone to our room right away to look into it. They did not find the cause but they did put peppermint in the vents and we kept the sliding doors open for the duration of our stay. The staff at the hotel were all professional and pleasant.

Excellent service staff very friendly food excellent and room great with sea viewBest breakfast we have had in a hotel and the evening meal in the restaurant was good value for money and we eat in the hotel restaurant 5 times and all the meals were excellent

This was our third hotel stay in a two week holiday and it left the competition standing.  From the moment that we walked in the door the staff were excellent and the standard never dropped for a moment.  The welcome was made to feel extra special with a little welcome taste of local food in the room and a complementary drink at the bar, neither of which we had been expecting.The location to see the city is good but it is on the edge of the key sights, and the taxi did drive through some 'interesting' streets to reach it, that we felt no urge to explore on foot!The room is geared up to short stay visitors with hand luggage, so nowhere to store any clothes and four hangers to use.  We had to live our of suitcases which made space rathe tight. The bed was very comfortable and there was a large bathroom which surprisingly lacked a bidet and the shower fitting was broken and had been so for some time.  Useable but awkward.  There is also a quiet side and noisy side to the hotel.  Our room overlooked the main road which had a constant flow of trams and sirens from the emergency vehicles passing by.  Not overly intrusive but noticeable.We did try to use the television one evening but the computer overlay for the hotel portal made it so slow and unresponsive that we gave up.  Wifi coverage though was good.  Security is up to standard with key access required to use the lifts or stairs.Unfortunately we were ill during our stay (completely unrelated to the hotel).  On our final evening we felt well enough to eat carefully in the restaurant and the chef cooked us a light meal, he then came out to enquire how we were and if the meal was suitable for us.  When I write that the staff were excellent they truly were.Highly recommended, you will not be disappointed.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Châteaux
text: Fabulous hotel.  Wonderful, helpful staff in so many ways.  Great location.  Highly recommend.  Walking distance to many of the sights. Also good food and music.  Lovely rooms. Also can arrange for a private walking tour.

Been to Lisbon twice and stayed this time in the Destination Hostel: and I fully recommend it to everyone who wants to visit Lisbon! The Hostel ist located in the centre of Lisbon; you can reach everything with the metro or by walking (bairro alto for example is a 5 min walk). Restrooms and sanatariy installations are new and clean. It's probably the cleanest hostel i've been to. The staff is very nice and always helpfull; we just had a great time there. The included breakfast was also very good. The atmosphere ist very layed back, i will definetly come back :)

The staff are super friendly and welcoming. Thais was really helpful at reception and always went out of her way to provide info/ideas on restaurants/things todo. Tatiana was very entertaining at the bar and made the space feel very inclusive. Martini done a great job facilitating the pub crawls. Overall I had a great experience and would recommend!

Great location,Lovely staff,A continental breakfast with delicious coffee,Our room: Rio House - Narcisos room was clear and comfortable,Bed linen changed every day,All you need to enjoy the beautiful Lisbon

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Having book a recently refurbished garden view deluxe room was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the refurb....... room was large, bathroom was beautifully appointed. However, the pool area ( brand new pool ) was unfinished and builders were still trying to get it finished, bit noisy as a result. Main restaurant was not open ( not finished) and all the Atlantic Suites were in the middle of refurb......shame

hotel_name: Pine Cliffs Ocean Suites, A Luxury Collection Resort & Spa
text: The info on the site is misleading. Some suites have an ocean view...when I called for the reservation they said it was on the ocean so I travelled some distance to get there, any yes, it said Pine Cliffs, so I did ask. Suites are nice. Lots of kids and young families .. big noisy.  Big property, lots of walking or commuting to other areas. All in all, a typical big resort property not on the ocean. A walk down a trail to the beach which is where you feel it's more like a holiday.

It was the first time in Porto for my girlfriend and me, and it was her idea to book at ` Casa Formosa`. In fact the hostel is the whole second floor of the building, so you first need a key to enter at ground level, a second one to enter the apartment and a third one to go into your own room. At the back there is a charming common kitchen where we made our own breakfast during the morning. Joao provides ingredients almost every day, so yoghurt, fresh fruit, corn flakes, bread and marmelade are all available for your own use. You can share a good bottle of Port or Vinho Verde together with some other guests on one of the two terraces. On the big terrace at the back there are two deckchairs for sunlovers.We slept in the room located closest to the entry which is very spacious and luminous. Apart from the double bed there is huge comfortable red sofa and a low table. I particularly liked the two huge windows, but due to the fact the streets are narrow, cars and person can be rather noisy. Wifi is ok.The apartment has two (also common) bathrooms which are located next to each other. Both have a toilet, lavatory and douche. The one near to the kitchen has a bathtub, the other does not. At night two small candles are lighted to guide your way to the toilet, so you do not have to disturb the other guests.Last but certainly not least is the terrific location. Not far from metro station Bolhão and within walking distance from the more touristic places at the river. Joao will give you excellent advice and recommendations for restaurants (both for heavy as for light meals) and attractions.Overall, this is a way more personal experience of travelling instead of just booking a room in a hotel!

hotel_name: Quinta Nova Winery House - Relais & Châteaux
text: Quinta Nova is an isolated estate in one of the oldest vineyards in the Douro.  It has sweeping views of the valley and surrounding vineyards, and the owners have developed several marvelous hikes through the property.  The restaurant served excellent meals, and the service was very good.  One note:  this is an isolated location, so if you want to eat something different from what they offer, you will need to drive a half hour or more.  Our rooms were all very comfortable, well-appointed and everything worked as it should (although all Portuguese hotels seem to think that it is fine for the shower water to drip/spray out onto the bathroom floor!).  For our group, it was our top location in eastern Portugal.

Fabulous hotel, with amazing reception staff.  We loved all the little extras the hotel provided.  We were a little worried about reviews about it being located in an “up and coming” neighborhood but felt at ease walking to and from the hotel. We are ate the hotel restaurant Infame, and enjoyed an excellent meal.   Great spot in Lisbon!

My husband and I came for the weekend with our daughter, husband and 2 sons prior to a week in Funchal and we absolutely loved it. We had a charming room in the hotel and they had the 2 bed villa, with a lounge and terrace, in the grounds. The boys, (6 & 4) loved the trip to the Madeira Theme Park, especially the bungee jumping and boat lake, which is only 1o minutes by taxi. We did a wonderful coastal walk, and the setting was sublime. The staff in the hotel were outstanding, helpful and friendly. Great swimming pool too. We all enjoyed the Gala Dinner on Sunday, with entertainment, and all in all it was a terrific choice of hotel.

Service and comfort. Rooms are what you can expect of the hotel and the service was impecable. The staff was very very nice. They helped us with all our questions.What I like: Staff and pillows.Location is compromise. Taxis in Lisbon are cheap and is 4-5E to the cinemas/mall and 6-7E to  Barrio Alto (I paid 9E but it was a lot of traffic).Subway is a 10-15 mins walk for me not a big deal. (I use the walk to buy cheap beers in the stores nearby the hotel)What I don't like: Internet 20E per day is way too expensive

Hotel is newer and clean. Good location Close to Tagus river, Belem, and public transportation. But the customer service was probably my best experience ever. And I travel a lot. I’d definitely stay here again. Highly recommended.

This well located hotel off Avenue Liberdade and close to Metro Station, is desperately in need of refurbishment, redecoration and a more fastidious maintenance regime.  The bedroom (102) decor and furniture was outdated,  room was gloomy, paper peeling and shabby, and bathroom fittings/ the shower unit was falling apart.

Just got back from spending 4 nights here with my mum. We paid for a studio but when we arrived the lovely lady at the desk said we could have a 1 bedroom apartment. Couldn't fault the room it had everything we needed and even a nice view of the sea! It's about a 5 minute walk from the beach, and there are 2 shops close by for water and food etc. The hotel is in a quiet place but it's about a 5/10 minute drive in a taxi to the old town and strip.We had a lovely time and it's a perfect place to stay for a relaxing holiday!quiet area

we were staying here for a friends wedding -there was a large group of us.. rooms are very spacious and beds v comfy -we were on the 5th floor facing the pool and had a balcony which i def recommend asking for..The staff were very friendly and helpful -really good breakfast, lots of choice... and we had super sunny weather which was perfect for the lovely outdoor pool..The hotel is in a great location -15 min walk to bars/restaurants etc...would def retunr!!!

I’ve never written a review for a hotel before but I had to this time. Carlos Santos is the manager at Hyatt Regency Lisbon and he went above and beyond what I expected for hospitality. The hotel rooms are brand new since the building was recently constructed last year. The spa was a great experience as Anna gives the best massages. Thank you Carlos and staff for a wonderful experience, I will be back and I’m a Hyatt client for life.

We come here every year.It’s a lovely resort and not too big.Over the years the restaurants have improved no end and food is great. Unfortunately this week has been a wash out and spoilt our enjoyment.I can recommend the Aqua fit classes,they’re great fun and if you need a P.T. Tiago is your man,

This is a solid 3 stars hotel. The reason is that while many of the common areas seem to be updated, the rooms are old and smelly. The location is not great, as the hotel is located between two freeways. Downtown Lisbon is about a 10 minutes taxi ride. Taxis will charge about 7 EU for the ride. Amenities within the facility seems adequate. The food is great, although it becomes repetitive after a few days. I guess this hotel is good for business, to so much for exploring Lisboa.

Conveniently  located by American Embassy. It is about  a 7 euro cab ride from the airport or the port. The rooms were nice but small. The bathrooms had been recently modernizes and the view from the rooms was nice. It was very quiet and the staff was extremely helpful. The in room dining was good. I would stay here again. One strange thing is that they do not change currency at the front desk. Internet speed was acceptable for work but had some issues streaming videos.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: A most wonderful experience where we ara transported to another era with all the state of the art ammenitties.Spacious rooms and a very personal service.Diving in the atlantic ocean is a must go when staying at the Reid's.

Overall this hotel is very poor. In terms of positives, the pool and pool area is good (although food service there is excruciatingly slow) and location is ok, walking distance from the (horrendous) 'strip'.The rooms, although spacious, are quite dated and are in need of freshening up. Towels in the bathroom are of terrible quality as is the shower itself. Also they don't clean rooms on Sundays, which is hugely inconvenient. Overall, very poor value for money.If you (have to) stay in Albufeira, choose another hotel.

The object could be pimped in Details. But the the spectacular property so close to the sea can hardly be surpassed. We will come back! The pool area is nice and clean. The breakfast room could be a bit bigger.

The Royal Savoy is a really pleasant hotel and although we were there because our original hotel the new,Savoy Palace,cancelled,we did enjoy our visit.The staff are all really lovely and the management should be proud of them all. They all work hard and are commited to keeping the hotels reputation high in Madeira.One area that could certainly do with improvement is their food offerings.  For a 5 star hotel some of the ingredients leave alot to be desired and for the price we were disappointed,the burgers and toastie s at lunchtime were particularly poor.Generally a good hotel.

This is one of the best hotels I've been at. The rooms are stylish and clean. The hotel has been recently refurbished so it's all very nicely decorated. The service is just amazing here. Everyone is very nice, friendly and helpful. We've booked directly on their website and got the half board that I can only recommend. The food is different every day (we've stayed 9 nights). The breakfast is top aswell. I'd only suggest a little bit more kinds of fruit (I miss strawberries, watermelon, cantaloupe melone). Oh my, but their pastry for breakfast. My husband is French so he can be a bit picky when it comes to croissant but here they know how to make it ♡. We've been here woth our 11 months old baby. They provided a cute wooden crib (not a travel one as hotels usually do). There's also a cool kids room with nice ladies who are there to play with kids. He loved to spend some time there. I and my husband had a massage too. That was a very lovely experience! Actually one massage was free with our stay! You also get free access to the sauna and other spa facilities. We are deffinetly coming back! ♡♡

This hotel is really the best you can get on Madeira. We had the Oceanfront Room, which was spacious and comfortable. And the view was excellent. The buffet dinner has lots of choice. The quality of the food is really good. The servings personnel is polite and friendly.

Another visit to the Tivoli and another lovely holiday. Superbly located hotel just a hundred metres from town. Our upgraded room overlooking the pool and cliffs was large and very comfortable. The staff in all departments were  helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Great food in the restaurant at both breakfast and dinner. One small request though - please can we have some cooked tomatoes for breakfast to go with the bacon and eggs?

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: Went at this fabulous little hotel last October 2016. We booked the Prestige suite and it was indeed prestigious... Renovated beautiful room, perfect comfortable 4 poster bed, amazing BIG shower, nice big balcony, 3 pools and a great breakfast each morning. But the most amazing thing about this place is the owner Manuel and his staff ( including family members like his nephew Sergio ). Nothing is too much trouble, everything is taking care of, fast and efficient service. We found there is absolutely no flaws with this place. We absolutely recommend this perfect place.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Its a very special luxury hotel with Old World charm, spectacular views, amazing restaurants, and wonderful staff. So blessed to be able to stay here. They have a van that will take you into Old Town, but its hard to leave the pool, with vistas over the ocean.

We stayed at Crowne Plaza for 3 nights. we was treated like royalty, the rooms where cleaned everyday of our stay, the hotel is very close the Vilamoura marina, we had breakfast everyday of our stay which I would say is exceptional food there is some thing for everyone it is a buffet style breakfast.We had an exceptional nights sleep there is no noise at all, all staff where polite and couldn't do enough for the guests. I would recommend this hotel for anyone.

My wife and I visited this hotel with our daughter for a short five day stay.  We booked a junior suite because of the room size in order to have a little extra space.  It was well worth the extra cost.The hotel is positioned near the harbour and has direct access to the excellent beach.  The grounds are generous for the size of the building and we found the pool layout very good with beds both on the timber pool side deck and on the grass around the area.  Umbrellas were substantial offering good shade.  A separate fenced-off small kids area had very good facilities with a decent kiddies pool, loungers for parents and a wonderful pirate ship climbing / activity area and we felt was one of the best we have seen.  The addition of more bins and directional signage to the toilets at the end of the pool would add value.A number of reviews spoke about the glass screen between the bathroom and the bedroom - this caused an element of panic amongst my two ladies until we realised that pressing a switch brought down a blind screen.  This leads me to my first concern which is that the electrics in the rooms are complex and nothing was labelled.  Overall we were delighted with the room which had a huge double bed which was very comfortable and a privacy curtain between that and the sitting area where an additional bed could be set up.  This was not the most comfortable but had plenty of space.  Towels could be better quality.Guests in the junior suites get to eat breakfast in a separate area poolside and in general we found the range of food on offer and the service to be good.  The addition of a good coffee machine at the serving table would be positive.  We ordered breakfast in our room when we were departing early and it was very good and arrived on time.  We did not eat in the hotel other than breakfast.Overall - we were very happy with the hotel and would recommend it hugely.  There is discussion in the reviews as to whether this is 5 star or not - to me that is not very important - we very much enjoyed staying at the hotel and were delighted that we had gone with the junior suite option.  It does not pretend to be anything it isn't and is a very good choice for those wishing to stay near the beach.

Just recently back from our holiday In Portugal.We stayed along with other family members at the Pestana Viking.Check in seemed to be a bit long winded - all very polite and welcoming but after a 5 hour delay to our flight we just wanted to get checked in and freshen up.The room was clean and tidy but the bathroom did need a bit of TLC in terms of repair and decor - it looked a bit outdated . It wasn’t bad by any means but this along with some other areas of the hotel just need a bit of refurbishment given it is rated a 4 star.The chose the half board option - both breakfast and evening dinner were buffet style offerings - I’m pleased to say I found both to be very good with plenty of choice on offer.The staff worked tirelessly topping it up as well as being very attentive in the dining area - I really must compliment them on how they interacted with our two young grandchildren - nothing was too much trouble for them.The same could be said when our son, his wife, who had got married at another hotel on the Algarve joined us one evening as well as other family. They brought wedding cake to share and the staff provided plates and cutlery for everyone.Most impressed with this.The hotel is well appointed with both indoor and outdoor pools, gym, steam room etc as well as a kids zone.There are other bars and places to eat locally. There is a small shop about 5 minutes walk away but a larger supermarket is about a 15 minute walk.Beaches, you will need to negotiate steps and hills but for most people this is quite manageable - less so for anyone with any mobility issues.To conclude, very happy with our stay but the hotel could do with a bit of a minor uplift away from front of house.

I have to admit I was nervous before travelling as I had read a few bad reviews only after I had made the booking.  We stayed for 5 nights all inclusive and at a very good price.Firstly we arrived in reception and were dealt with by a lovely gentleman (sorry didnt get his name but he was very friendly and helpful) he got us checked in and even though our room was not ready (arrived around 12.30pm) he told us to go to the restaurant and enjoy some lunch and our room should be ready around 2pm.  We had a lovely lunch and our room was ready at 2pm.  We were shown to our room by the lovely Bruno, he was so nice and carried our bags etc, very polite and a great asset to the place.  Our room was small and basic but very clean and had everything we needed and we had the perfect sea view, we could actually lie in bed and listen to and watch the waves roll in on the beautiful beach below.  We really could not complain about the room, service or food especially with what we paid, it was very good value.  The restaurant staff were so nice and friendly especially one lady who was particularly kind to me when I needed something that was not normally available at the time, I do not know her name (wearing pink shirt and dark sleek ponytail) but she was a credit to the place and very professional.If I was to pick any negatives I would say it would be that the place is a little tired in places but did note that there seems to be a lot of work going on to improve this, covid probably did not help with places like this and things were let slip a bit.  It is a pity that the Ocean Bar is not presented in a nicer way - it has so much potential with the fabulous views and the sound of the sea but it really is so tired looking, the flooring is all mismatched and furniture mixed and just not the most pleasant place to sit but it should be as it is the perfect location.In relation to the poor reviews that stated they could not sleep with the noise at night I can honestly say we never heard a thing at night except the beautiful sound of the waves.All in all we had a lovely stay here and am struggling to understand the very poor reviews.  Good value for money - I would return.

Had a great week here with my partner, Aunt, Uncle and Cousin.Apartments are spacious lovely and very clean.The pool and surroundings are beautiful and well looked after. Rooms have AC and WiFi.The Maid even left a bottle of champagne and chocolates in my uncles room for his birthday.Too staff i would like to say thanks for the wonderful week at you apartments from The Anderson/Angus party.Can't wait to return for my 3rd time in next year ðŸ˜Š

Excellent location and staff were brilliant. Would stay there again. Ideally placed for all main attractions within walking distance. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable. If travelling to Lisbon make this an option.

This may be our favourite hotel from staying at dozens around the world!We stayed here 16 June to 30 June 2018. We were originally supposed to stay at the Tivoli Marina hotel, which is a few minutes walk away from this hotel. However, our travel agent e-mailed days before we departed to advise construction work was ongoing. As such we were allowed to adjust our booking, and we opted to stay at the Crowne Plaza.We made such a great decision opting to move to the Crowne Plaza. Everything was great! Highlights include:Great beds and view from the room. We elected a Vilamoura facing Deluxe room and were really pleased with it. Complimentary bottles of water were provided every day. Coffee making facilities are available too, but we requested and were quickly provided with a kettle to make tea. The bathroom was modern and good shower, and all other stuff you'd expect with a five star hotel was in place (robes, slippers, plenty of towels).Breakfast was included and there was plenty of choices. We skipped it a few times as we preferred a longer sleep, but went most mornings and I don't think I had the same breakfast twice. The omelettes were particularly nice and made to order per your request.We used room service a couple of nights after a long day of shopping in Faro and attending the Quarteira saints festival. The food arrived 25 mins later, as advised when ordered, and was great restaurant quality. Portions were also overly generous! Probably the best room service I've had in Europe and North America.Nice bar area that never felt too crowded, with plenty of screens for those that wanted to watch sport like golf, tennis, or world cup football. Also easy to find a quieter spot. Staff were attentive and took and delivered drinks orders to your table.The hotel grounds are equally nice and spacious. We didn't go to the pool often, maybe 3 times, but always managed to get sunbeds. There's also sunbeds available at the garden area away from the pool. The grounds are very well maintained.The gym is open 24/7 with plenty of towels. We planned to use the inside pool and facilities but didn't get round to it. Looked great from a passing perspective though.The marina is a very short walk away, and there's a couple of routes. Neither take too long. This is where the bulk of restaurants, bars and ice cream parlours are. The Family Golf is also a reasonable walk, and great day out. The bus stop to visit Albufeira and Faro is a few minutes away outside the casino, which is next to the hotel. Very easy to travel around from this hotel, and taxis are also reasonably priced.At the end of the street at the main road there's a Spar supermarket, which is great for picking up random bits and pieces.I'd definitely stay again. And most likely will before long! We got really luckySpecial mentions to:Fantastic check in and out with Mario. He provided lots of useful tips that helped us throughout our stay.Miguel helped us with every step of mapping out an excursion, really helpful.Andre was a really friendly barman, and even acted as a photographer on our last night after fixing us some great (albeit non-alcoholic!) cocktails.One point to note was one of our party tripped at night on/near the hotel grounds. There's a path that takes you from the main road to the hotel via the hotel next door. I'm not sure who owns the land, could be either hotel or the local authority, but more lighting and improvement works to level the paving would be useful.

Stayed here the last week of October 3 adults and 1 child. Reception staff and bar staff excellent, friendly and very helpful with anything we requested.Great choice at breakfast as mentioned many times before but the staff at the end of a long summer season appeared to be suffering from \tourist fatigue\" and we're as friendly as their other colleagues. Whatever you do don't help yourself to coffee
month: your pot is brought to the table (would like hot coffee)Rooms were excellent spotlessly clean and spacious
year: the quirky bathroom \"window\" was a big hit with our 6 yr old. We had a side sea view and a view of Quarteria overlooking the hotel courtyard.Excellent wifi all over the hotel.Pool towels provided daily as you'd expect in a 5*.Disappointed with the indoor pool having a fee but we knew that before we arrived and the good weather meant we got to the beach every day so it wasn't an issue.Good location about 10 mins stroll from the Marina with plenty of places to eat and drink.Overall a great holiday
extracted_date_str: not sure it warrants a 5* just a couple of little things missing. Free access to the indoor pool and friendlier breakfast staff (not all were unfriendly).Wouldn't have any problem recommending this hotel to anyone."

text: We have been staying here for over 25 years. Lovely gardens right by the ocean. Delivers comfort every time even though this complex is now very dated and there are newer more modern places around. Good value for money although more expensive this October as a lot of people have got wind of the good weather in the Algarve well into October. Will be back next year as usual. Tip... if you can get the two bed room apartment you will pay more but you get loads of room and facilities.

During a recent trip to Portugal, we made an impromptu decision to check out this hotel as some friends had heard that it was very nice.Being a member of The Leading Hotels of the World, I decided to check on their web site but surprisingly it showed no vacancy so I tried browsing directly on the hotel's home page and it showed various categories of rooms available. We were a group of 4 and we needed two rooms. We could not make up our mind as to which category room to book out of the three types of options that was available for the two days stay. We decided to call the hotel up and inform them that we were in need of two rooms and that we would be driving down from Lisbon which would take approx 2 hours. They told us it was perfectly fine.We reached the hotel at around 2 pm and Mr. Rui (with whom we had spoken on the phone) arranged for us to see the 3 types of rooms and we opted the middle category. As we had not had lunch, we straight away went to their restaurant and were pleasantly surprised with the level of service and also the quality of freshness in the food. Since all four of us are vegetarians, we also asked the server if we could speak to the chef so that he could perhaps cook us some pasta and other things for the dinner that evening. Here again they were very accommodating and the chef had arranged very delicious and fresh food for dinner.The rooms are very rustic and yet very elegant. The bathroom sizes were very big and the room type we chose had a small terrace area at the back with table and seating.All through our stay, we all felt that the service level was excellent and everyone had a pleasant smile and amazing and warm attitude. The housekeeping ensured that the rooms were serviced properly and kept in great condition.We were also very happy with the variety of the spread at breakfast. The quality of the bakery items was top notch.Frankly speaking, at first, I was a little sceptical to stay at this property as it literally seems like its away from civilisation but we all were taken aback at the quality of service and also the variety of food and beverage options.The reception team assisted us with booking a hot air balloon ride and whenever we would contact them by WhatsApp, the response was very swift. My wife had accidentally dropped her eyeglasses in the balloon basket which the people at the hotel very kindly arranged to send to a local friend in Lisbon.I suppose there were only two minor let downs for us. On the second evening of our stay, we decided to try their outdoor barbecue dinner. While we were assured that there would be a fair bit of variety for vegetarians, it was somehow not very fulfilling. The other let down was that the hotel told me that I was not entitled to get any points for the stay since the booking was not done through the Leading Hotels of The World web site. I clarified to them that the web site was clearly showing us no vacancy so I could not make the booking through that site. They finally discussed with them and gave me 50% of the due points. Barring these minor issues, I would say that I will gladly want to go back to stay at this amazingly friendly and beautiful hotel whenever I am next in Portugal. Definitely among one of our most memorable hotel stays.

hotel_name: Porto PalÃ¡cio Hotel by The Editory
text: From being welcomed by the doorman with the top hat, to the specious (Deluxe) rooms with a nice view over Porto, the friendly staff, the cosy bar with big screen (to watch FC Porto!), and the acceptable distance to the airport... Great stay with a premium look & feel!

We have visited Quinta das Achadas a second time and enjoyed it just as much. Its very relaxed and informal but equally very comfortable, very conveniently situated for all the area with plenty to do - likely to go again...

1. On arrival, there was no provision for dinner, even for the 2 year old with us. We arrived before dinner ended at 9.30pm but had to queue for over an hour just to sort out our rooms.2. Terribly disorganised reception - we booked our rooms 2 months in advance but still all 6 rooms were scattered throughout the massive complex. One person requested a ground floor room in advance as she was disabled but was advised she could not have one.3. We had to walk several hundred metres up hills and steps just to get from our room to reception and to any facilities e.g. the restaurant.4. Staff were rude at the reception, there was no service with a smile there!5. On the day of check-out, we were asked several times to empty our rooms even though we had paid extra to keep them until 6pm.5. The WORST thing was the food, there was very little variety, and I'm sure some was re-heated or re-used for more than one meal. Proof of this was after one particular lunch, 5 out of 10 of our guests were in bed within 6 hours with vomiting and diarrhoea. Our toddler was very unwell for a week even after returning to the UK and had to be admitted to hospital for IV fluids.6. Generally very noisy day and night. Walls and doors very thin.

Magnificient SPA and Pools (both indoor and outdoor), tranquillity and professionalism in the SPA, one of the best gourmet restraurants we had dinner in for a very long time. Top !The location couldn't be any better, smelling the see breeze and yet close to excellent museums.

Took 6 days at this hotel at the end of June with my wife and 2 children which turned out to be a lovely break. The room was very comfortable with an impressive view and small kitchenette area complete with fridge. The offer would took included breakfast which was very good with a large selection of things from fruit / cereals to eggs, bacon etc.The hotel has an outdoor and indoor pool area with inside being advertised as a Spa area which it is although the pool was always full of kids, some well behaved and others not. The Stream Room broke down but the Sauna was good.The staff were all really friend and helpful but I on criticism would be the slow service around pool area bar during the day. We didn't eat during the evening as it was buffet style set up and as there are many a decent restaurant a short walk or drive away we eat out every night. Would of liked to stay longer and a wonderful tim, considering return next year but for longer.

Modern with excellent views and in the best location in Belem.  Breakfast is first rate.  Service is attentive.  Less than 5 minutes to Tower of Belem and Monument to the Discovery.  10 min to Natas and Jeronimos Monastery.

The staff:All the staff were very helpful - we checked in to our room within 3 minutes arriving at the hotel. The staff guided us around and if you had any queries they would attend immediatelyWhen we were leaving, the hotel arranged taxi, which only cost 15 euros to the airport (cheap!!!)Location:The hotel is about 15-20 minutes away from the airportThe hotel is situated 3 minutes walk from the metro, (marques de pombal) so very useful if you want to see many of at attractions of lisbonBeing situated at the centre of lisbon, there are plenty of restaurants and takeways few minutes walk from the hotel. They have got mcdonalds opposite the hotel, which is very handyWhen you leave the hotel, turn left and walk down the street you will see a supermarket (really cheap to buy the basics - we realized on the last day though)Rooms:The rooms are very large and quite clean. The beds were comfortable so had no problem. The rooms had balcony but we were given the front rooms (where the view was not all that (street view) but that didnt bother us)The kitchen had all the basics (mircowave, cooker, fridge, plates, cups etc) but do bring some fairly liquid and sponge.Had a plasma in our room and used the safe (middle of wardrobe)A cleaner would come every day in the morning to clean the sheet and provide new towels. The shower was clean and had all the essentials.At the back there is a swimming pool (didnt swim) but did soak some sun - in the evening would come back to hotel and just relaxWe never tried the food at the hotel so cannot commentOn the whole the hotel was amazing - felt like at home. I would def recommend this hotel to everyone - i have read the previous reviews and would agree.

Myself and my partner visited this hotel for my birthday in May 2025. We arrived around 11.30 and was made aware the check in time to the hotel is normally 3pm, which was fine with us as it meant we could use the pool after being on the plane. The reception staff we very friendly and kept our luggage safe.The location of the hotel itself is very breathtaking. The chapel located at the end of the hotel is also worth a visit but may be challenging to walk to, for those with mobility issues as its located on a hill. The local cuisine and town is very nice with good options for food and drink.The pool and bar area featured some delicious food and drinks, and the service was very good especially from Ruben who worked at the bar area.The outside pools were very nice, only drawback were they were very cold. Given the time of year, they could have done with being alot warmer. The indoor spa pool was heated  to a comfy temperature, and the jacuzzi and other facilities such as the sauna were also very warm. The only drawback is the spa could do with an update, it is showing its age and is quite run down with bits of flaking paint present in the jacuzzi.The food at the restaurant was very nice, and had a different dish each night. The fish pie and vegetarian lasagne are very nice and worth a try! Good selection of different food each night and a good variety for breakfast.We had a suite with a sea view. The room was very clean, and had good facilties such as a microwave, oven and washing facilties. They also provided us with two wine glasses. The only thing that could be improved is some cutlery could be provided in the draw.There was plenty of space in the room itself and in the wardrobe, the bed was comfortable but the duvet was slightly itchy (but I do have sensitive skin). Overall, the suite was very nice and spacious.I was very happy with my stay at this hotel and would visit again. I'd also like to mention how fantastic the staff are, they left a birthday cake for me with a lovley message in my room on my actual birthday. I felt very appreciative of this as I hadn't mentioned it was my birthday, and this made me feel welcomed.Would like to thank the staff for a lovley stay and myself and my partner will be returning again!

We were in room number 114, ocean view at the first floor: clean and simple, with a stunning view on Mareta Beach and on the garden! Breakfast was an experience: tasty meals, great choice and the opportunity to stay in the garden.  Kind staff: we'll return.

A disappointing stay. The hotel is in its 3rd year of operations so we assumed things should be at the optimum level. No. We stayed there for 6 nights.1. Lack of amenities and basically no refill, even for toilet paper, box tissue and complimentary water. We had to call the front desk to refill the stuff everything things were used up.2. Room service. Very limited choice aside, staff also forgot the basic stuff. Meal for 2 persons was given just a set of utensils, no plate. We ordered iced lemon tea which came in a bottle but without a bottle opener. We waited for 15 minutes before the bottle opener was brought to hs.  That was not a single incidence and it happened to two of our meals.3. Food quality. We had buffet breakfast for six consecutive days at the hotel and surprisingly there’s NO change to the breakfast options. The hotel was serving literally the same food everyday. Was expecting at least one or two local food options like egg tart but none.  Very limited food options. On our 2nd last day my hubby sensed that the food was not fresh enough and he’s right. Immediately after breakfast he had diarrhea for two whole days….4. Hardware. It looks nice on the outside but the toilet door on the ground floor was broken and couldn’t be closed.In short, a disappointing stay.

The hotel is 5 star quality at a reasonable price. The rooms and facilities are excellent and the inclusive breakfast was as good as you could wish for (lots of fresh fruit, meat, cheese, pastries, bread + hot stuff)The staff were very helpful and friendly at reception and in the bar. There is a large lobby area which is very inviting and was useful to us as we were in a big party. the hotel is in easy walking distance of the centre of Tomar.

I was just in awe of the talent, planning, and effort that went into the stunning transformation of this older building in the center of Porto.  Every detail is absolutely brilliant and it was a pleasure for me to spend  2 days admiring such thoughtful design excellence… (taking home more than a few ideas).Marco and his staff gave us a very gracious welcome and were most helpful with advice and assistance all through our stay.  Our room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable, including the bedding.  There were a lot of thoughtful touches around the room.Breakfasts were a la carte with many choices.  It’s a small hotel…very cozy…and the breakfast is served in an elegant dining area with beautiful table settings….a lovely way to begin your day.The location is excellent.  So many things in walking distance.I would return in a heartbeat.

Just wow... the views for which this place was named after are absolutely worthy of the title.Comfy beds, stunning location, beautiful touches and meticulously designed. This Guest House was heaven.Sagres is gorgeous and the guest house will provide towels and umbrellas to bring to any of the wonderful local beaches.Breakfast of the terrace here has been a highlight of our trip. There’s an AMAZING seafood restaurant right across the road too (Conchinha) with authentic local cuisine (try the Cataplana). We stayed for 3 nights here then headed up to Arrifana. We loved it so much we came back to Mareta View for our last 2 nights.Guests have access to the pool which is in their sister hotel next door. The infinity pool has the most exceptional views and a bar that makes an amazing sangria. Juan, the bar tender is friendly, knowledgeable and took great care of us.We will definitely be back here... Paradise

Staff were really helpful and attentive.Small problem of shower not working which was not resolved during the two night stay. Late check was offer but then on the day refused which meant there was very little time to moved what I had for my business plans.The hotel room layout was great but if travelling as a couple I would advise there is no bathroom privacy as it it a glass wall and door which does not fully slide closed. This is by design.The room had great facilities, coffee, kettle, fridge, steamer, hairdryer,  everything you would need, great desk space, all perfect.I would have comfortably said 5 stars had the shower been fixed and check out not been retracted, these two things caused big problems.

Large room (210), located in the center of hotel above the beautiful fountain.  Complimentary bottle of port.  The room was comfortable, the bed was great.  The breakfast was spectacular.  I would recommend to every discriminating traveler.  The only drawback is the king-sized bed on the platform.  It looks wonderful, but I tripped and badly bruised my knee when I forgot about it on a nighttime bathroom trip.  Also laundry service was slow as they forgot about us and had to rush it upon checkout.

Casa Vela is a world apart in Cascais old town. Very central but tucked away on a quiet street with its own private botanic gardens. Loads of charm, very friendly and very comfortable. The suites have large verandas that allow indoor/outdoor living in your own hotel room.

Being right on the Marques de Pombal square this is a great location for walking into central Lisbon, using the metro or the open-top tour buses that start from the square. The hotel is value for money, rooms are spacious if bland and bathrooms are somewhat tired. But it has ridiculously small public areas for a hotel of this size. There are three lifts but they are of the tiny, only four or five people at a time size which doesn't work for a big, busy hotel like this. And breakfast management was hilariously incompetent. We had to queue before we could enter the breakfast room (like wait for ten minutes) which was odd because, although the breakfast room is way too small for a hotel of this size, there were always obviously empty tables. And the staff didn't really help by allocating a table for six to two elderly English ladies while pushing three smaller tables together for a smaller family of five. We were also woken twice by the cleaning lady who was doing the room next door but left the door open and broke off to have shrieked conversations on her mobile phone. So, in sum, an unremarkable but well-located hotel that is value for money at its current rates but there are probably better options in the wonderful city that is Lisbon.

Once again a wonderful 16 night stay at this splendid hotel.We would strongly recommend to anyone seeking a quality 4 star hotel.The staff are so friendly and make certain you will experience \a stay in paradise\"Robert Webb and Suzanne CarringtonExeterEngland"

hotel_name: ibis Styles Lisboa Centro Liberdade NE
text: The hotel is a nice three-star hotel conveniently situated near the Avenue of Liberty (Avenida Liberdade) and the metro station (Marques de Pombal, 5 min away). The room was typical of an Ibis Styles hotel (new refurbished with style, lean and practical). Very clean and satisfactorily comfortable. The breakfast was good with satisfactory choices. The service of the personnel was very good (reception and bar). I liked my stay at this hotel and I would like to stay again next time I will visit Lisbon.

Ok, first off, this place, and Sintra, were the best part of our entire trip. Don't make Sintra a day trip--definitely go there and stay there!  This B&B is just one one-bedroom apartment.  It's incredible and I can't say enough good stuff about it.The owner, Carole, is just lovely and adds all sorts of little touches to make it feel like a place you want to stay in...she provides fresh bars of soap, a new sponge, and a spotless apartment.  this may sound like little things, but it makes you feel at home.  She provides breakfast--by leaving fresh fruit, breads, and plenty of eggs, juices, milk and coffee.  I like that it wasn't \Please come sit down at this time and you'll eat what i prepare.\"The location is qonderful--it's a five minute walk (at most) from the downtown area of Sintra.  We were in heaven when we realized JUST how close everything was.The garden is large and amazingly beautiful.  There is a terrace (with table and chairs) that overlook the valley--where we ate all of our meals.  Since we have two small children who went to bed early
month: we would get take out from nice restaurants and eat our dinners out there.  It was heavenly.Carole is very nice and so accomodating.  She gave us tons of suggestions and even helped us out (keeping our baby in safe arms and playing with our daughter) as we were packing up.  I can't say enough nice things about her.She has a lovely pool--prob the ONLY downside to the trip is that the water was too cold to swim--but she said she's soon putting in a heater.  The pool is VERY lovely."

text: Stayed here overnight a nice hotel withwith good bathroom comfortable bed and the breakfast was good the hotel was right next to Fatima so great location for candlelight procession at 0930 and mass in the morning great stay

In the middle of a 3 night stay at the Park Hotel Porto Gaia.  The hotel is very clean, fresh towels every day and if you need clean sheets they will change them too.  Nothing seems too much trouble for the staff who want to please their guests.  Although the hotel is only 2 star I think this is because of the lack of a safe in the rooms and possibly other amenities but what it lacks for on some aspects it certainly makes up for in others.  Indeed I have been in  much worse so called 4 star hotels.  I would certainly recommend this hotel and we are staying again on our return trip in a couple of weeks.  We are on the 4th floor and even though it is very near to the main road there is very little noise as there is such good soundproofing.  The buses into Porto 901 and 906 are quite near - less then 5 minutes walk and run fairly regularly.  The breakfast is good and there are several small cafes nearby together with a Burger King.  All in all a very good value for money hotel.

Terrible attention from management and staff. They didn't check us in until 1. And then they told us they were changing our hotel. We refuse!!! We feel cheated!!! They ruined our trip!!! We are waiting for an apology!!!

The staff was amazing extremely kind! The hotel is clean, beautiful and confortable! The food is delicious! The spa is so relaxing and very complete! I will come back for sure! Thank you for this amazing stay. :)
